se.hig.exte.restcontroller

Class SubjectController

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.hig.exte.restcontroller.SubjectController

  • @RestController
 @RequestMapping(value="/subjects")
public class SubjectController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a RestController class responsible for mapping HTTP requests for the /subjects path. It contains mappings of end-points to CrudServices that operate on Subject records in the database.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Creates a SubjectController object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SubjectController

        @Autowired
public SubjectController(SubjectService subjectService,
                                     UnpublishService unpublishService,
                                     CookieHandler cookieHandler)
        Creates a SubjectController object.
        Parameters:
        subjectService - The CrudService class used to perform all services exposed in this RestController.
        unpublishService - A CrudService class used to perform services exposed in this RestController.
        cookieHandler - object responsible for handling authentication.

    • Method Detail

      • saveSubject

        @PostMapping(value="/")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Subject> saveSubject(@Valid @RequestBody
                                                                                             @Valid Subject subject,
                                                                                             javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Creates a Subject and stores it in the database.
        Parameters:
        request - To see if the user and cookie are valid.
        subject - The Subject to add in the form of a JSON-object in the POST request.
        Returns:
        A ResponseEntity object containing the saved Subject and an HTTP status code.

      • getSubject

        @GetMapping(value="/{id}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Subject> getSubject(@PathVariable
                                                                                               int id)
        Fetches the Subject object with the given ID from the database.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the Subject to fetch.
        Returns:
        The Subject with the given ID.

      • getAllSubjects

        @GetMapping(value="/all")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<Subject>> getAllSubjects()
        Fetches all Subject records from the database and returns them as a ResponseEntity object. List of Subject objects is automatically converted to JSON using Spring Boot's HttpMessageConverter and put in the ResponseEntity's body.
        Returns:
        A ResponseEntity object containing the fetched Subject objects.

      • getUnpublishedSubjectsByAcademyId

        @GetMapping(value="/academy/{id}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<Subject>> getUnpublishedSubjectsByAcademyId(@PathVariable
                                                                                                                                              int id)
        Fetches all Subject objects belonging to the specified Academy ID. List of Subject objects is automatically converted to JSON using Spring Boot's HttpMessageConverter and put in the ResponseEntity's body.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the Academy to which the Subjects belongs.
        Returns:
        A ResponseEntity object containing a List of Subject objects.

      • getPublishedSubjectsByAcademyId

        @GetMapping(value="/published/academy/{id}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<Subject>> getPublishedSubjectsByAcademyId(@PathVariable
                                                                                                                                                      int id)
        Fetches all Subject objects belonging to the specified Academy ID. List of Subject objects is automatically converted to JSON using Spring Boot's HttpMessageConverter and put in the ResponseEntity's body.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the Academy to which the Subjects belongs.
        Returns:
        A ResponseEntity object containing a List of Subject objects.

      • patchSubject

        @PatchMapping(value="/")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Subject> patchSubject(@Valid @RequestBody
                                                                                               @Valid Subject subject,
                                                                                               javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Updates the Subject object with the given ID in the database.
        Parameters:
        request - To see if the user and cookie are valid.
        subject - The Subject to update in the form of a JSON-object in the POST request.
        Returns:
        A ResponseEntity object containing the updated Subject and an HTTP status code.

      • search

        @GetMapping(value="/search/{text}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<Subject>> search(@PathVariable
                                                                                                                    java.lang.String text)
        Searches the database after subjects with the text variable
        Parameters:
        text - The text searched
        Returns:
        If super-user: list of all subjects that are a match and the http status OK. If not logged in: a list of all published subjects that are a match and the http status OK.

      • getUnpublishedSubjects

        @GetMapping(value="/unpublished")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<Subject>> getUnpublishedSubjects(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Fetches all unpublished subjects.
        Parameters:
        request - To see if the user and cookie are valid.
        Returns:
        A list of all unpublished courses and the http status OK.

      • unpublishSubject

        @PostMapping(value="/unpublish")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Subject> unpublishSubject(@Valid @RequestBody
                                                                                                           @Valid Subject subject,
                                                                                                           javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Changes the boolean unpublished value on the subject
        Parameters:
        subject - The subject to update
        request - To see if the user and cookie are valid.
        Returns:
        The ResponseEntity string of the http status.

public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<Subject>> unpublishSubjects(@RequestBody

        Changes the boolean unpublished value on the Subjects
        Parameters:
        subjects - The subjects to update

        Returns:

      • autoUnpublish

        @Scheduled(cron="0 4 3 * * *")
 @GetMapping(value="/testAuto")
public void autoUnpublish()
        This method is run automatically by Spring Boot at 03:00 every day.
